actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-115, by Mr. Hall (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2621 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. During consideration of the bill, all points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with clauses 2 and 6 of rule XXI are waived. Measure will be read by title. Specified amendments are in order. No amendments shall be in order except for the amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. The amendments shall be considered in the order and manner specified in the report and shall not be subject to amendment except as specified in the report and shall be debatable for the period specified. All points of order against the amendments are waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 30.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 264 - 135 (Roll no. 180).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2621) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2621 (foreign operations funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2621) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
